background: He was an 18th-century German philosopher, born in 1724 and passed away in 1804. He was a prominent figure of the German Enlightenment and made profound contributions to ethics and epistemology. He introduced the concept of "transcendental critique" and emphasized the limitations of reason and the universality of moral behavior. His works, such as the "Critique of Pure Reason" and the "Critique of Judgment" had a profound impact on subsequent philosophy.
